Intervention: - Radiologist A's evaluation of the prone to supine MRI
Radiologist A, number of participants successfully segmented
Radiologist B's evaluation of the prone to supine MRI
Radiologist B, number of participants successfully segmented
Eligibility: Invasive Histological Diagnosis of Breast Cancer or In-Situ Channel Carcinoma
The size of tumours is at least 1 cm in diameter, as seen on mammography or in the United States.
A diagnostic breast MRI is considered clinically appropriate.
Ability to voluntarily provide informed consent to participate prior to any assessment or procedure related to the study.
• Absolute contraindication to MRI, including the presence of an implanted electrical device (pacemaker or neurostimulator), aneurysm clip or a metal foreign body in or near the eyes.
Contraindication to the use of an intravenous gadolinium contrast, including life-threatening allergy or impaired renal function (eGFR < 30 ml/min/1.73m2).
The patient's statement that they are not pregnant will be acceptable.
Results: Number of images of successful segmentation of suspended MRI
- Determine the number of cases that can be successfully segmented from the use of contrast-prone MRI images and also from the use of post-contrast MRI images.
Title of arm/group: Suspended MRI prone evaluated by radiologist A
Description of the arm/group: Radiologist A, number of participants successfully segmented
Type of measure: Number of participants
Title of arm/group: Suspended MRI prone evaluated by radiologist B
Description of the arm/group: Radiologist B, number of participants successfully segmented
Type of measure: Number of participants
